ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

Savr is a progressive web app (PWA) for saving online content to read later, emphasizing offline access and user data control. It functions as a 'read it later' service that allows users to save articles and other online content for offline viewing, removing distractions like advertisements. Savr can be used as a hosted service or self-hosted, and it supports optional authorization and cross-device synchronization via Dropbox or Google Drive.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

S3Sync is a Go-based tool designed for high-speed synchronization of files to and from S3-compatible storage. It supports multi-threaded uploading/downloading and offers flexible filtering options, making it suitable for managing large numbers of small files. It can sync between S3 and local filesystems, or directly between S3 buckets.

RustedLessPass is a standalone password manager written in Rust and WebAssembly, compatible with LessPass. It allows users to generate and manage passwords securely without server-side dependencies, offering a platform-independent solution accessible through any modern web browser.

DockrTUI is a terminal dashboard for Docker, built with Rust and Ratatui, designed for managing containers, images, networks, volumes, and Compose projects. It provides a keyboard-driven interface for quick actions like starting, stopping, restarting, and inspecting Docker resources, aiming to simplify Docker management.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

Pipedash is a desktop application designed to aggregate and manage CI/CD pipelines from multiple providers like GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Buildkite, Jenkins, Tekton CD, and ArgoCD into a single interface. It allows users to view pipeline statuses, browse run history, trigger workflows, and manage builds across different platforms from one central location.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

Lazyssh is a terminal-based SSH manager that simplifies server management by providing an interactive UI for connecting to servers defined in the user's `~/.ssh/config` file. It allows users to quickly navigate, connect, manage, and transfer files between their local machine and servers, eliminating the need to remember IP addresses or run long scp commands.
